title: Healthcare boss, 42, 'defecated on rug of property tycoon whose wife left him for Cesc Fabregas'
text:
Jefferson Brito (pictured outside Westminster Magistrates' Court) allegedly barged his way into Elie Taktouk's plush Belgravia home

A healthcare boss caused £42,000 worth of damage to a property tycoon's flat by defecating on a rug and slashing oil paintings with a butter knife, a court heard.

Jefferson Brito, 32, allegedly barged his way into Elie Taktouk's plush Belgravia home on Cadogan Square and demanded to stay the night.

Westminster Magistrates' Court heard Mr Brito was 'extremely drunk' when he emptied his bowels on one of Mr Taktouk's carpets and attacked the paintings with a blunt blade.

Mr Taktouk is is the ex-husband of Daniella Semaan, who is now married to Cesc Fabregas.

Prosecutors allege Mr Brito he damaged five paintings, two statues, a candle holder, an assortment of men's clothing and a rug during his late night rampage in September this year.

Malachy Pakenham, prosecuting, said: 'This is an odd case, the defendant went to the victim's property on 20 September, at around about 11pm.

He described the scenes as 'a deliberate and sustained campaign of criminal damage within someone's own abode.'

Brito is also accused of assaulting two people, Dinka and Borislav Stoyanova at the address.

Elie Taktouk (left), who is the ex-husband of Daniella Semaan (right, with Cesc Fabregas), is said to have been subjected to a sustained campaign of criminal damage at his home

Magistrate Jonathan Saunders said: 'You pleaded not guilty to these three charges and, as you have heard, it has been sent to the Crown Court.

'You're on conditional bail. There are two conditions, we are going to keep these conditions going.'

Mr Brito was told not to enter Cadogan Square nor to speak to any of the three alleged victims in the case.

He works as a business relationship manager for the private healthcare provider HCA Healthcare, describing himself on LinkedIn as: 'Self-motivated, organised and target orientated.'

Brito, of Notting Hill, denies criminal damage and two counts of common assault. He was bailed ahead of a preliminary hearing at Isleworth Crown Court on 4 November.
description: Jefferson Brito, 32, allegedly barged his way into Elie Taktouk's plush Belgravia home in central London and started slashing at oil paintings with a butter knife.
